definition: a special assignment that is given to a person or group, to saturate
details:
noun
- a special assignment that is given to a person or group
= synonyms: mission
- attention and management implying responsibility for safety
= synonyms: care
- an impetuous rush toward someone or something
= example: an impetuous rush toward someone or something
- a quantity of explosive to be set off at one time
= example: a quantity of explosive to be set off at one time
= synonyms: burster, bursting charge, explosive charge
- heraldry consisting of a design or image depicted on a shield
= synonyms: bearing, heraldic bearing, armorial bearing
- in criminal law, a pleading describing some wrong or offense
= example: in criminal law, a pleading describing some wrong or offense
= synonyms: complaint
- an assertion that someone is guilty of a fault or offence
= example: an assertion that someone is guilty of a fault or offence
= synonyms: accusation
- a formal statement of a command or injunction to do something
= example: a formal statement of a command or injunction to do something
= synonyms: commission, direction
- request for payment of a debt
= example: request for payment of a debt
= synonyms: billing
- the swift release of a store of affective force
= synonyms: kick
- the libidinal energy invested in some idea or person or object
= example: the libidinal energy invested in some idea or person or object
= synonyms: cathexis
- a person committed to your care
= example: a person committed to your care
- the quantity of unbalanced electricity in a body (either positive or negative) and construed as an excess or deficiency of electrons
= example: the quantity of unbalanced electricity in a body (either positive or negative) and construed as an excess or deficiency of electrons
= synonyms: electric charge
- the price charged for some article or service
= example: the price charged for some article or service
- financial liabilities (such as a tax)
= example: financial liabilities (such as a tax)
verb
- to saturate
= example: to saturate
- to energize a battery by passing a current through it in the direction opposite to discharge
= example: to energize a battery by passing a current through it in the direction opposite to discharge
- to cause formation of a net electrical charge in or on
= example: to cause formation of a net electrical charge in or on
- to set or ask for a certain price
= example: to set or ask for a certain price
- to attribute responsibility to
= synonyms: blame
- to instruct or command with authority
= example: to instruct or command with authority
- to instruct a jury about the law, its application, and the weighing of evidence
- to impose a task upon, assign a responsibility to
= example: to impose a task upon, assign a responsibility to
= synonyms: saddle, burden
- to blame for, make a claim of wrongdoing or misbehavior against
= example: to blame for, make a claim of wrongdoing or misbehavior against
= synonyms: accuse
- to make an accusatory claim
= example: to make an accusatory claim
- to file a formal charge against
= example: to file a formal charge against
= synonyms: file, lodge
- to make a rush at or sudden attack upon, as in battle
= example: to make a rush at or sudden attack upon, as in battle
= synonyms: bear down
- to direct into a position for use
= synonyms: level, point
- to fill or load to capacity
= example: to fill or load to capacity
- to provide a device with something necessary
= synonyms: load
- to place a heraldic bearing on
= example: to place a heraldic bearing on
- to cause to be agitated, excited, or roused
= example: to cause to be agitated, excited, or roused
= synonyms: rouse, excite, turn on, agitate, commove, charge up
- to lie down on command, of hunting dogs
- to move quickly and violently
= synonyms: shoot
- to pay with a credit card
- to demand payment
= example: to demand payment
= synonyms: bill
- to enter a certain amount as a charge
= example: to enter a certain amount as a charge
- to give over to another for care or safekeeping
= synonyms: consign
- to cause to be admitted
= synonyms: commit, send, institutionalize, institutionalise
- to assign a duty, responsibility or obligation to
= synonyms: appoint
